GOOGL.title: Alphabet: Fundamentals Indicate A Waning Corporation (NASDAQ:GOOG)
GOOGL.summary: Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) is an excellent business in terms of generating net income and free cash flows. However, with respect to long-term growth potential, the company is far from attractive. Google Search is engaged in a losing battle with competitors slowly but surely capturing market share. The Other Bets segment, comprised of smaller companies, that remain unprofitable, is in our opinion, a loss leader, designed to accumulate customer data, to further personalize GOOG's advertisements.  Google Search's desktop share has declined to 83.8% from 90.8%, and that related to Bing has expanded to 9.89% from 3.4%. Google Search will likely continue to dominate global search for a while due to strategies the firm has implemented to preserve a significant fraction of the search engine's market share.  The Other Bets segment of Alphabet is comprised of unprofitable companies which are highly unrelated to each other and to the corporation's core competency. The only similarity (between the new firms) is that they are developers of emerging technology. Google Cloud's potential for generating substantial long-term growth appears doubtful, as we have discussed above. We believe fundamentals do not support significant growth of Alphabet's business.  Over nine months ended September 2022: revenues were $207 billion, reflecting a growth of 13.4% compared to the same period in FY2021. Earnings per share was $3.50 versus $4.08 over nine-months ended September 2021. At the end of F3Q2022, Alphabet had a cash and cash equivalents balance of $22 billion and long-term debt of $14.7 billion on its balance sheet.

GOOGL.title: Google Stock: Layoffs Change It All (NASDAQ:GOOG)
GOOGL.summary: Google layoffs are a turning point for the company - the layoffs that were so necessary. The inflection point I am talking about is a clear bullish sign that it's finally time to buy GOOGL at a fraction of the desired total position. Even selling covered calls could work well at this price point.  Google's latest LLM – Pathways Language Model – which used 540 billion parameters (22% of the training corpus being non-English) – surpassed prior large models, including GPT-3 and Google's LaMDA, on 28 of 29 tasks. Google's DeepMind came up with the gold standard around how LLM performance is optimized by suggesting that both the LLM model and the training model it uses should be scaled simultaneously.  Google stock is currently trading at 12.4 times TTM EV/EBITDA, which is about the 2010-2015 low even though the P/E TTM ratio is still quite high. I think Google deserves a slightly higher exit multiple - about 12x. This is already 25-30% below the long-term median of this multiple. The layoffs were a necessary decision, and their impact should support the company's margins in the foreseeable future.

GOOGL.summary: Cash-Secured Put strategy is kind of the mirror opposite of the Covered Call strategy.This is a strategy that is used to collect premiums to generate a consistent income stream.The Wheel Strategy does require some capital in your account via cash or margin. Covered Call options are selling a Call Option with a strike price above or Out-of-the-Money.If GOOGL is below $100.00 at the expiration date, your 100 shares get assigned away and you still keep the $100 in premium. Selling a naked put option is risky and many brokerages will not even allow you to do so.If you sell a call option without owning the shares like you would for a Covered Call, then it is called a naked call.

GOOGL.title: My Top 3 Stock Picks For 2024
GOOGL.summary: Big-tech stocks have driven the market's double-digit rally in 2023.The S&P 500 has risen by 14% since the end of October and this rally has erased a lot of attractive bargains that I used to see in the market.There will be a time to buy the best-in-class dividend growth stocks again...but right now, I'm looking to allocate cash elsewhere.  NVDA's net income has increased from $1.45b to $10.02b during the trailing twelve months.It's a y/y increase of 1259% on a GAAP basis.The stock's 241% year-to-date gains don't seem so irrational.  AMZN's CEO, Andy Jassy, has very bullish things to say about the long-term growth runway ahead of AWS.That double-digit growth trajectory is expected to remain in place and ~20% growth on a high margin, $50b run rate business factors in heavily to the company's justifiably high multiple. Alphabet has posed positive annual annual EPS growth in 18 out of 19 years.That sort of growth, combined with historically cheap multiples, makes this an easy stock for me to buy right now.Alphabet clearly owns some of the world's most attractive digital billboards with its Android, Google, and YouTube brands. Alphabet is actually growing its earnings at a faster rate than Microsoft (MSFT), which is currently trading with a forward P/E ratio of 33x.The company has the potential to dedicate hefty funds towards R&D and/or M&A to ensure that Alphabet remains relevant in the tech sector, while handsomely rewarding shareholders.

AAPL.title: How a Protective Collar Options Strategy Works
AAPL.summary: A protective collar is an options strategy that could provide short-term downside protection.The protective collar involves two strategies known as a protective put and covered call.Both the put and call are typically out-of-the-money (OTM) options, and must have the same expiration.Protective collars are particularly useful when the broad markets or specific stocks are showing signs of retreating after a sizable advance. Apple is trading above $185 (say $187) just before the March 20 option expiration date.The collar thus has a net cost, excluding commissions, of $85.If you did not have the collar in place, the gain on your Apple shares would only be $7,500 (i.e., the difference between the current price of $165 and the initial cost of $90 x 100 shares.

Tom Siebel is the founder, chairman and CEO of C3.ai, that's NYSE ticker symbol AI.The importance of being first to fully harness the technology growing so significantly.Condoleezza Rice recently spoke with our former Secretary of State about the AI race.  Tom Siebel: C3.ai is one of the largest AI applications deployed on Earth where we take all these signals, we run them through machine learning models.The B-1 bomber airframe has 42,000 sensors emitting telemetry at eight hertz cycles. That's eight times a second.Siebel: We're going back to some of the defense applications a little bit later on our conversation. The AI winter goes back to like 1950 when all these technologies were invented and really nothing happened for almost 75 years until we finally saw the elastic cloud become preeminent, big data, internet of things.Now, C3.ai is fulfilling its mission to establish a leadership position in that space.If we look at the AI market today, the value is perceived of in the silicon and the infrastructure. Tom Siebel founded C3.ai in 2009, about 16 years after established Siebel Systems.Siebel Systems was the leading CRM application of the day and in 1999 the fastest growing company in the US.The company has found itself in an enormous market tailwind where there is insatiable demand for these applications. Siebel Systems is the fastest growing enterprise application software company in history.S Siebel was acquired by my former colleague, Larry Ellison at Oracle in January 2006.Tom Siebel: We are right on plan, and the market has played out about as we expected.The company has given itself a couple of different names in the C3 space. C3 Energy rebranded as C3 Energy to address the market opportunity that was there at the time was almost exclusively utilities and oil and gas companies.The company applied predictive analytics at massive scale to those value chains in Europe and in North America.Tom Siebel gave a $50 million donation to establish the Siebel School of Computing and Data Science housed within the Thomas M. Siebel Center for Computer Science, which was dedicated back in 2004. The University of Illinois is merging data science, computer science, and engineering structurally.Tom Siebel and CEO of C3.ai, NYSE ticker symbol AI, give us a five star rating, if you will, and a review.Siebel: It's important to emphasize the overlap and collaboration between these two fields. The AI market is, I think, very confusing for business people, and it's confusing for investors.Tom Siebel: We're unique in the space that we are really the first native AI company.He says generative AI is going to fundamentally change the nature of the human-computer experience. C3.ai showed its 20% year-over-year revenue growth.Tom Siebel: It's going to have a very important effect on change management and making these technologies available.The idea that we have to have this expertise in data science is just not true, he says. In February, we received 10,500 inquiries, the CEO, CFO, the person in charge of supply chain and manufacturing, customer service, whatever it may be, at some of the world's leading companies.The interest in generative AI is unlike anything I've seen in my professional career, Tom Siebel says.  OpenAI CEO Sam Altman highlights potential risks associated with generative AI.Tom Siebel: It's a privilege to be at the table, and it's the beginning and end.The company's high levels of interest is growing, interest is expanding. We know that these technologies are manipulated by rogue states and bad actors to interfere with the democratic process.The human brain has 60 billion neurons, makes 100 trillion connections, and all these connections are analog, again, with dopamine and with neurotransmitters and neuromodulators, and operates on 17 watts. An algorithm can be used to create a public health hazard.It can make it unlawful to publish an algorithm, as I described in social media.But why criminalize science when we can put the people who publish them, people like C3, Facebook, others, and make them responsible.
